page.title: 07Farming in Eaton Bray area
page.content: Sadly, the old Wallace nurseries and plum orchards, with 8 acres of greenhouses, formerly the largest employer of local labour and famous for its roses and carnations has now been converted to housing development. Farming is now the major land user, with seven farms and two agricultural contractors in the area. About half the land is cultivated, mainly for wheat and barley; the remainder is managed grassland, much of it used for grazing riding horses and ponies. Currently there is one milking herd and another farmer raises cattle for beef. A new council-built farm has been empty for over a year as farmers cannot afford the rent, due to EEC cuts in milk quotas. One horticultural concern sells plants to garden centres and a new concern is establishing a nursery.
